meanings.definition: To make a serrated edge or surface.
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to serr the paper for the craft project.
meanings.sent2: The chef likes to serr the vegetables for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally serred the fabric while trying to cut it neatly.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to serr the clay to create a unique texture.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the saw as it serrs through the wood is satisfying.

meanings.sent1: The old book had a serr along the pages from years of use.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range had many serrs that added to its rugged beauty.
meanings.sent3: The serr on the metal sheet made it difficult to handle.
meanings.sent4: The serr of the broken glass posed a danger to anyone nearby.
meanings.sent5: The hiker carefully navigated the serrs of the rocky terrain.
